table.task: Are all images/photo posts/videos in "Stories" or "Portfolios" accompanied by alt text or descriptive captions/labels?
If there are prerecorded videos, can you add captions, and are they correct?
Is there a transcript alternative where needed (especially for audio content)?
Can color contrast be checked (text vs background, non-text elements)?
Can text be resized (browser zoom, device settings) without breaking layout or cutting off important content?
Can all main features (instructor feedback, messaging, navigating between classes/stories/events) be done via keyboard only?
Are UI elements (buttons, links, menus) reachable and usable via keyboard or switch devices?
Does focus move in logical order (when tabbing)?
Are touch targets / buttons large enough (on mobile) for users with motor impairments?
Are there orientation issues (does the app force portrait or landscape in ways that disable user's preferred orientation)?
Are instructions, labels, and feedback messages clear and consistently placed?
Are error states or input problems clearly identified and described in text?
Does changing language / translation preserve meaning and clarity?
Are pop-ups, dialogs, or context changes triggered only when the user expects them (not surprising on focus etc.)?
Works well with common screen readers (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver, TalkBack)?
Do exported or posted materials (e.g. messages, images) remain accessible when accessed through your LMS or school-provided devices?
Is the HTML semantically correct (headings, lists)?
Are accessible name, role, and states programmatically exposed?
Are keyboard / assistive tech users able to opt into alternate input methods?
